results.title: Act of necessity
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Channel 4, Pamela Williams and Ian Munro
results.brief_description: Act of necessity, set in rural New South Wales, explores the conflicts faced by a community whose health is threatened by the use of chemical sprays. One woman’s concerns are brought to a climax when her daughter becomes fatally ill and her search for answers is frustrated by a wall of bureaucracy. Beautifully photographed, it provides a compelling argument about the dangers of chemicals to the environment and the collusion of silence from people in power.

results.title: Act of God: some lightning experiences 1966-1980
results.creator_credit: Thames Television, Udi Eichler and Peter Greenaway
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Take Six”.
An investigation of lightning as an arbitrary intervention in people’s lives, with devastating consequences. It is made disconcerting by the idiosyncratic combination of the bizarre and the everyday. While the film technique is sophisticated, much of it is very amusing.

results.title: Across the Strait
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission, Robert Horne and Ken Taylor
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Wild Australia”.
The Cape Barren goose one of the world’s rarest species, is found on the island in Bass Strait. Looks at the birds in their natural environment and describes their varying fortunes at the hands of man. Other birds filmed include Pacific gulls, cormorants, black swans, the chestnut teal and the spur-winged plover also emphasising research by Dr. Dorward on Glennie Island.

results.title: Across the Sea of Galilee
results.brief_description: Filmed on the eve of the historic Arafat Peace Agreement and records the daily lives and views of Jews, Palestinians and Christians. We learn how they perceive their country during this time of change, how they deal with constant war and the conflicts of the different religions in the Middle East. We are taken on a series of adventures; camel riding across the Negev Desert to meet nomadic Bedouin tribesman, kibbutz living on a Lebanon border and driving tanks in the Golan Heights. We also see female soldiers on the Syrian border, a Jewish wedding and the ultra-orthodox Jews of Mea Shearim who dress in 18th Centruy styles from Eastern Europe.

results.title: Across the Pacific
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, First National Pictures, Jerry Wald, Jack Saper and John Huston
results.brief_description: Adapted from the ‘Saturday Evening Post’ serial of the same name name by Robert Carson, this taut World War II thriller reunites the stars of John Huston’s earlier hit,’ The Maltese Falcon’. Humphrey Bogart plays Rick Leland, a tough, cynical Army officer given a bogus dishonorable discharge and sent undercover to hook up with Japanese sympathisers on the eve of Pearl Harbour. Aboard a freighter bound for the Orient, he plays a ticklish game of matching wits with the enigmatic Dr. Lorenz (Sidney Greenstreet), spiced by the presence of the mysterious and beautiful Alberta Marlow (Mary Astor). Huston made this film the year after making his directorial debut with ‘The Maltese Falcon’, and like that classic, this film is full of cool and subtle characters, sharp dialogue, and a plot chock full of twists and turns.

results.title: Across the Great Divide
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Explorers [Bill Peach]”.
Using historical documents and footage as well as dramatised re-enactments, Bill Peach follows the journey of Evans, Oxley and Cunningham as they cross the Great Dividing Range. He describes the reasons behind their travels, why they chose the route they took, and the ensuing changes to Australian society resulting from their discoveries.

results.title: Across the frontiers
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board, Stanley Hawes and Shan Benson
results.brief_description: This film was made at the invitation of the United Nations Organisation to illustrate the part played by Australia in a UNESCO campaign to foster better understanding between nations. Technical advances have broken down the old barriers to knowledge, but there still remain the barriers in men’s minds. The film illustrates the work being done by UNESCO in breaking down these remaining barriers.

results.title: Across the Antarctica: a transatlantic view
results.brief_description: In an interview with Robert Mackenzie two members of the Commonwealth Trans-Antarctic Expedition - the leader Dr. Vivian Fuchs and Sir Edmund Hillary, in charge of the New Zealand party - discuss details of the plans for crossing the Antarctic Continent during 1955/58.

results.title: Across Canada with Princess Elizabeth
results.brief_description: A memorable record of the 15,000 mile tour of Canada by Princess Elizabeth and the Duke of Edinburgh. Opening with the Royal couple’s tumultuous reception in Quebec, the film covers the full extent of the tour. Narrated by Bernard Braden and Barbera Kelly.
